post.date: Posted: Thu Jun 08, 2006 1:07 am Post subject:
post.author: Brain Trepaning
post.body:
Ya, there will be a couple of spots where some systems will choke briefly, but I don't have one of those systems and didn't have to consider it. I don't play video games, and can actually list the names of those I have in less than 30 seconds, so I am not familiar with what makes good gameplay. Duck Nukem was created basically for three reasons: To generate some interest in the engine modding scene by keeping it light, to create a repository for my tests from learning how to make custom monsters, and last, and most importantly, to MEET THE DEADLINE I said I would meet (thus, there was time management to consider). I am one man with a bit of spare time, and this is what I was able to get accomplished in the time I allotted for it. I like to work that way. Consider this version of Duck Nukem an alpha, with the full story and layout in place. Now, allow me another 6 months to pretty it up and optimize it. Or allow me a team to do it in a couple of months. It won't happen, but pretend it would. Okay, the humor will still suck, but otherwise...

Anyway, glad to read it brought a couple of "heh"s out of your crusty old self, Zombie13. That's enough to make it all worthwhile. That, and the babes it will get me!

Here's a screenshot from Duck Nukem, for those too intelligent to waste their time downloading my mods:


_________________
Good Bye!

post.date: Posted: Sat Jun 10, 2006 6:26 pm Post subject:
post.author: Brain Trepaning
post.body:
Haha, thanks everyone, I will lighten up!

I use GOD mode and/or GIVE ALL for all my gaming needs!

I have NO idea if this mod can actually be beaten by standard play, as I never had a chance to run through it before the deadline, sorry! I'm going to look into what makes "good game play" now that I have the time. (Any recommended tutorials greatly appreciated)

The mod's really all about the rock and roll anyway!

Episodic content, haha!

(Holy overuse of exclamation marks...)
_________________
Good Bye!

post.date: Posted: Sat Jun 10, 2006 7:44 pm Post subject:
post.author: T0r1t0
post.body:
Hey Brain, I see that you used a few things from my Damnatio Memoriae HUD!

I haven't have enough time to finish your mod yet, but I like it so far. I had to use GOD mode from the very start. I really don't mind those mapping "mistakes" at all, I think it's part of the style. Anyway, congrats!

post.date: Posted: Sat Jun 10, 2006 8:07 pm Post subject:
post.author: Brain Trepaning
post.body:
I used all kinds of things from all over, but your HUD text display find brought one of the hugest smiles to my face, let me tell you! I bookmarked the page with a huge TEXT!!!!! to make it stand out.



I left the remainder of the HUD items I found in your mod in case anyone was poking around. I didn't use them, just the text display, but they sure are worth people checking out. That HUD text display is awesome, because it'd be really easy to make multi-language patches. Thanks a lot!
_________________
Good Bye!

post.body:
What this mod lacks in polish, it certainly makes up for in originality. Loaded with just about every conceivable customisation possible... and an off-the-wall sense of humour.

A great reference point for anyone wanting to mod anything in Doom 3.

Nice 1 Brain!
